Trump and Putin: A toxic and opaque relationship
description: For nearly 20 years, the US president has shown a clear fascination with his Russian counterpart, whom he is set to meet at a summit on Ukraine this Friday in Alaska. His real estate empire has benefited greatly from Russian private capital.

description: Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, who has advocated for the construction of 3,000 housing units in the E1 settlement, said it would 'bury' the possibility of a Palestinian state.

headline: Negotiators fail to strike international treaty on plastic pollution
description: After 10 days of intense negotiations at the UN in Geneva, Switzerland, delegates from 185 nations could not find common ground on how to tackle plastic pollution. Some countries said they were prepared for future negotiations, despite six rounds of failed talks over three years.

headline: In Lyon, green islands offer a cooling solution to heatwaves
description: Elected officials and urban planners say greening the city must shift from a landscaping approach to a strategy focused on cooling in order to adapt to climate change – as was done in the former industrial district of Gerland.

headline: Charlotte Perriand's family's relentless mission to keep her legacy alive
description: Since the death of architect and designer Charlotte Perriand in 1999, her legacy has been in the devoted hands of her daughter and son-in-law. Their meticulous work has played a significant role in elevating the prolific 'Charlotte' to the rank of design icon.

description: Over the past decade in Brittany, western France, fishing boat owners have been hiring crew members from Senegal, who are drawn to the region by wages higher than those paid in Spain.

headline: Who's going to lie down on the couch? 'The Sopranos,' the first TV series to tackle mental health
description: 'Breaking The Script' (3/5). In 1999, the TV series 'The Sopranos' introduced viewers to a mafia boss suffering from depression. Through the intense exchanges between this anti-hero and his therapist, mental health became a central theme on television for the first time, where it has continued to thrive ever since.

headline: The love story between an old man and his 'great oak,' the tallest of its kind in the world
description: At the heart of Vallespir, in the Pyrénées-Orientales, Serge Arnaudiès discovered a 300- or 400-year-old cork oak. Recognized as the tallest in the world and labeled an 'Arbre remarquable' ('Remarkable Tree'), the specimen now draws many visitors.
